channel.title: Server Status Moderation
channel.description:
I know the MITB Mod's can't really do anything(Pointed out by Davidi2 Mods can remove Ad's). But I would suggest getting some sort of Moderation going.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=vote&desc
A lot of these votes are not legit.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?sort=time&desc
Then as I am posting this, there is 1 server that is posted [b]16 times[/b] (on page 1) More on page 2.
As I went through, there was 1 server not 10 days old that had nearly 1,000 thumbs ups. I understand it is possible, but in reality I don't think so.
It would just be nice to give the real servers a shot, not these servers that cheat their way to get players.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php is the most popular RSPS Server Advertisement, it should be kept clean.
Edit: What I'm getting at is it needs more attention by staff, or a separate staff team dedicated to this.

item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:4, topic:528645”]A lot of it can be changed by just code, it doesn’t need us. If anyone wants to take a look at the source and edit where appropriate then go ahead.

If people want moderators to take action on it we have to be informed. If we aren’t told we can’t fix it.[/quote]I agree with Ruby.

The staff and the community are both aware of the issues, however without us reporting the spammers they cannot take appropriate actions. We need to remember that the staff here are volunteers. Meaning, they really aren’t required to do jack even if a lot of times they do it anyways a lot of times.

There are several members of the community who are talented in web development and I’m sure could assist MITB in improving and creating new security features for the SSP.
